abstract.p: Letter from Haskel M Haddad, president, World Orgn for Jews From Arab Countries, says America's war on terrorism should include conditional grants to overpopulated Arab and Islamic countries to help them develop agricultural and light-industry projects away from urban centers to create employment, especially for youths

block.p: Re ''Radicalism: Is the Devil in the Demographics?'' (Week in Review, Dec. 9):

America's war on terrorism is being waged in the military and propaganda spheres. We have to extend it into the educational and economic arena. What is needed are conditional grants to the overpopulated Arab and Islamic countries to help them develop agricultural and light-industrial projects away from urban centers to create employment, especially for youths.
Re ''Radicalism: Is the Devil in the Demographics?'' (Week in Review, Dec. 9):

America's war on terrorism is being waged in the military and propaganda spheres. We have to extend it into the educational and economic arena. What is needed are conditional grants to the overpopulated Arab and Islamic countries to help them develop agricultural and light-industrial projects away from urban centers to create employment, especially for youths.
Grants could also provide for schooling beyond the madrasas, concentrating mostly on primary education and on developing teachers who would teach the Koran without the revolutionary input.

The billions of dollars needed could be pooled from the United States and its Western allies and administered by the United Nations. Money so spent would reduce high birth rates, alleviate unemployment and help us avoid future wars.
HESKEL M. HADDAD President, World Organization for Jews From Arab Countries New York, Dec. 10, 2001
